newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-DUTCH REFEREES THREATEN STRIKE OVER PAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DUTCH REFEREES THREATEN STRIKE OVER PAY.

text.p: Dutch soccer referees are threatening to go on strike in September if the Dutch Soccer Union (KNVB) does not offer improved terms, the Dutch news agency ANP said on Wednesday.
The referees want increased match fees, pension rights and payments similar to those received by players when their photographs are published.

The KNVB has offered to increase the fee for top referees to 1,750 guilders ($1,050) per match immediately and 2,000 guilders ($1,200) in three years time from 1,000 ($600) now. The referees are demanding 2,000 guilders immediately.
The referees union has advised their members to go on strike during a league round in September, with the date to be set five days ahead of a strike.
